[[Center(begin)]]
== '''Validation of HARMONIE-36h1'' ==

[[Center(end)]]

== Introduction ==
A coordinated validation of [wiki:Harmonie_36h1 harmonie-36h1] has been organised in HIRLAM-A with a primary view to enable release of the first official and '''quality assured''' HARMONIE forecast system, [wiki:ReleaseNotes36h1.3 36h1.3, targeted for tagging at the end of 2010]. Following the plan in HIRLAM-A, 36h1.3 includes a set of default (baseline) configurations which defines an operationally feasible meso-scale forecast system including that of data assimilation. To address the requirement about quality-assurance, a series of [wiki:Harmonie_36h1/ValidationTests36h13 validation experiments for 36h1.3 ] has been conducted for technical and meteorological evaluation, both by means of conventional observation verification inter-comparisons and by episode studies.

Following the successful validation of 36h1.3, several follow-up impact studies have been done to test various correction and updates on top of the tagged 36h1.3. In June 2011, the updated version with harmonie-36h1 (stable branch) is again validated for selected configurations efore tagging of 36h1.4

== Validation experiments ==
For each validation study, an user experiment is setup with reference to a version of the HARMONIE trunk, (and after release of 36h1.3, the harmonie-36h1 branch). A series of experiments are launched with varying configurations for two selected month-long periods 2010010100-2010013118, a rather cold winter month in North Europe, and 2010080100-2010083118, which is characterised by several heavy rain episodes. The baseline experiments are defined for three model configurations using AROME and ALARO physics, all cycled with 3D-VAR and coupled to ECMWF forecast as lateral boundaries,respectively
 * AROME: DENMARK and FINLAND domain at 2.5 km grid spacing and 65 vertical levels, 24 h forecast
 * ALARO: SCANDINAVIA_5.5 domain with 5.5 km spacing and 60 levels, 36 h forecast

In addition, some validation studies also involve alternative configurations to examine sensitivities on
 * domain
 * vertical resolutions (using MF_60 and HIRLAM_60)
 * assimilation scheme (downscaling; surface analysis only; 4dvar with ALADIN)
 * physics & surface schemes (edkf vs edmfm in AROME, ALARO with surfex vs isba scheme)
 * impact of spin-up period following cold-start

== Validation results ==
Observation verification inter-comparisons have been made to cross-compare HARMONIE validation runs with different configurations, and also relevant operational HIRLAM forecasts from DMI, FMI and SMHI. In addition, a short period with several extreme summer precipitation cases has been investigated to examine performance of the HARMONIE forecasts

=== Observation verification ===
For 36h1.3, inter-comparison has been made to look for answers to questions such as,
 * How does AROME 3DVAR-runs compared to blending scenario and to non-cycled downscaling scenario (without any data assimilation)?
 * How does ALARO 3DVAR-runs compared to blending scenario?
 * How does AROME, ALARO and ALADIN compare?
 * How does HARMONIE-AROME compared to operational, high resolution HIRLAM at similar resolution?
 * How does HARMONIE-ALADIN compared to operational HIRLAM at regional scales (ca 10 km)?
 * How does ALARO/ALADIN compare at 5.5 km?
 * How does ALADIN runs compare with 5.5km vs 11 km resolutions?
 * How is sensitivity with surface scheme in ALARO model?
 * How is sensitivity of vertical resolution with AROME/ALARO model?
 * How does 4D-VAR compared to 3D-VAR
 * Sensitivity due to source code update following implementation of 36T1-bf9

After tagging of 36h1.3, several tuning experiments have also been performed, 
 * Sensitivity due to correction about use of several conventional obs data (surface and aircraft data)
 * Sensitivity due to use of onset of CANOPY_DRAG switch
 * Test of EDMFM scheme in AROME, following correction by Wim de Rooy 
Details for the above validation results can be found in the wiki page about [wiki:Harmonie_36h1/ValidationTests36h13 details validation of 36h1.3 ] 

For 36h1.4, the validation are limited to check the new versions against the tagged 36h1.3 with various corrections and updates committed to the harmonie-36h1 branch during the past half year, especially
 * impact of corrected snow analysis 
 * impact of switching AROME-edkf to AROME-edmfm option
 * Impact of LMIXBC=yes for ALARO
 * in addition, impact of length of warm-up period for screen level temperature and humidity is also examined.

=== '''Headlines of main validation conclusions about 36h1.3''' ===
  * ''AROME produces forecasts with comparable skill to those of operational HIRLAM at 3-5 km resolution; AROME forecast is seen to be capable to forecast extreme summer precipitation cases''
  * ''ALADIN runs produce forecasts of basic parameters with comparable skill to those of operational HIRLAM at 5 to 10 km range''
  * ''AROME and ALARO suffers deficiency in forecast of cold Nordic winter temperature''
  * ''AROME forecast in 36h1.3 suffers excessive surface wind bias. This can be effectively eliminated through activation of CANOPY_DRAG switch in surfex''
  * ''In AROME runs, a clear benefit of surface data assimilation is shown compared to 'dynamic downscaling' case. 3D-VAR results in improved initial fit but the benefit disappear along forecast length. Tuning needed''
  * ''In ALARO, 3D-VAR has negative impact on surface humidity and related forecasts''
  * ''After correction on some settings in 36h1.3 about observation data usage, ALADIN-4DVAR provides comparable scores to that of 3D-VAR''
